column4: Hey, is there a way to stop Ubuntu 11.10 recording everything I do?
what is it recording exactly?
and where does it record them to?
how should I know?
so you don't know what's recorded or where to, you need to chillout dude
it doesn't record anything
there is no recording, there is internet history like ANY OS
there are logs for dpkg and udev which are lost on reboot and are useful for debugging issues
there isn't anything to stop, there is no recording of any sort
sure it does. Press windows-button to enter dash, and view programs or files&folders tab. Giving that blatantly false advice is weird and dangerous and creepy, mind you
those are the recent docs, then file suggestion based on the contents of your home folder
I don't use unity, hitting windows key brings up my lxmenu
yes. I know. And why are recent docs recorded? Why are commonly used programs recorded?
convenience, so you can run them faster, windows does that too in the 2 bar start menu style...

http://askubuntu.com/questions/34592/how-to-clear-recently-used-files-without-using-a-terminal   may also clear the apps list, Ive never met anyone as paranoid as you. I bet you walk the streets with tinfoil on your head
you can use gnome tweak tool to make it not record the recent docs
people can hack in or steal your password and then access your system at any time, recent docs list or not

its a netbook. It can easily be stolen, and it has ridiculous amounts of sensitive data about me, exact nature and extent of data is unknown to me, and i really don't like diving into finding out all the ways this data could be used against me
then use encryptfs and keep a backup, no need to worry then
using encryptfs will mean that if the drive is removed or such, the data will be garbage
yeah, i've thought of using that
you should if you are THAT paranoid
I know. It embarrasses me a bit that I haven't done that :/
in what way, switch teh entire layout or just one key?
